resources:
Midterm Prep What is the practice of keeping fields within a class private, then providing access to them via public methods?
//Button Texts A B C D E Prev Submit Next
What is the practice of keeping fields within a class private, then providing access to them via public methods? 

[A] Polymoprhism 
[B] Encapsulation 
[C] Cybersecurity 
[D] Hacking 
[E] Hide And Seek (B) What is a special feature of Java that lets programmers create new classes that share some of the attributes of existing classes? 

[A] Inheritance 
[B] Abstraction 
[C] Method Overloading 
[D] Method Overriding 
[E] Object-Oriented Programming (A) In what subfolder are string resources stored in? 

[A] mipmap 
[B] layout 
[C] drawable 
[D] values 
[E] manifests (D) With what file can you change the layout of your Android app? 

[A] layout.java 
[B] layout.xml 
[C] activity_main.xml 
[D] design.java 
[E] design.xml (C) Strings are _________ while Arrays are _______. 

[A] primitive data types, objects 
[B] able to be concatenated, not able to be concatenated 
[C] immutable, mutable 
[D] A and B 
[E] None of the Above (C) XML documents must contain one ____ element that is the ______ of all other elements 

[A] root, parent 
[B] basic, parent 
[C] parent, root 
[D] common, parent 
[E] None of the above (A) What does Regex stand for? 

[A] Regional Express 
[B] Random Elongated Generic Example 
[C] Regular Expressions 
[D] A and C 
[E] None of the Above (C) What type of data type is a String? 

[A] A Primitive Data Type 
[B] An object 
[C] A variable 
[D] A and B 
[E] None of the Above (B) The keyword ______ denotes that a method can be called from code in other classes, or that a class may be used by classes outside the class hierarchy. 

[A] private 
[B] void 
[C] extends 
[D] if 
[E] public (E) Android SDK uses ____ primairly. 

[A] Java 
[B] Python 
[C] HTML 
[D] CSS 
[E] Javascript (A)
Your final score is:
